metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6888 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the net_tx_pkt_init function in hw/net/net_tx_pkt.c inQEMU (aka Quick Emulator) allows local guest OS administrators to cause adenial of service (QEMU process crash) via the maximum fragmentation count,which triggers an unchecked multiplication and NULL pointer dereference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6888` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-guest-agent - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-keymaps - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-kvm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-system - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-system-aarch64 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-system-arm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-system-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-system-mips - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-system-misc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-system-ppc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-system-sparc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-system-x86 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-user - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-user-static - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
qemu-utils - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.30').
